epd_metadata.address: Level 40, Northpoint Tower, 100 Miller St, North Sydney NSW 2060, Australia
epd_metadata.product_group_classification: UN CPC 375 (Articles of concrete, cement and plaster)

product_description.general_description: Concrete prepared by mixing cement, coarse and fine aggregates, and water, with or without auxiliary agents and additives. Used for foundations, slabs, footpaths, and other construction applications.

product_classes.normal_class: Designed for everyday applications such as residential and commercial foundations, driveways and footpaths.
product_classes.special_class: Supplied to major construction projects including high-rise buildings, dams, roads, bridges, marine applications, and architectural finishes.

product_description.hazardous_substances: None listed in Candidate List of Substances of Very High Concern exceeding 0.1% by weight
product_description.packaging: Delivered in bulk with no packaging
product_description.classification: Non-Dangerous Goods according to Australian Code for the Transport of Dangerous Goods by Road and Rail

lca_information.scope: Cradle to gate (modules A1-A3) with options (modules A4-A5), modules C1-C4 and module D

background_data_preferences: Product specific EPDs for cements, admixtures, pigments and fibres
Australian National Life Cycle Inventory Database (AusLCI v1.42) (2023)

allocation.method: Physical allocation based on weight or m³ of concrete; economic allocation used when physical allocation not possible

excluded: Environmental impact from infrastructure, construction, production equipment, and tools not directly consumed
Personnel-related impacts such as transportation to/from work
cut_off_criteria.included: All materials required for manufacturing delivered without packaging except packaging of materials

data_quality.temporal_representativeness: Data updated within 10 years as required

system_boundaries.upstream_processes: Raw material extraction, transport, manufacturing, and electricity generation
system_boundaries.core_processes: External and internal transport, manufacturing of concrete (excluding mixing in truck), waste and wastewater treatment
system_boundaries.downstream_processes: Distribution, installation, construction waste, deconstruction, transport and treatment of waste

installation.assumptions: Based on industrial expertise and GCCA tool
installation.activities: Pouring concrete from truck and pump, manual finishing; excludes site work and formwork

end_of_life.control: No control by Holcim over end-of-life fate

deconstruction.method: Physical drilling and removal using hydraulic excavator

benefits_and_loads_beyond_system_boundar.use_of_recycled_aggregate: Recycled aggregate replaces virgin coarse aggregate depending on product performance requirements

targets.2030: Embodied carbon of all construction materials to be at least 40% lower
targets.2050: All new construction materials to be net zero

carbonation.description: Natural process of CO2 absorption by concrete over its lifetime, offsetting some emissions
carbonation.note: Not reflected in EPD results tables

allocation_method.fly_ash: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included
allocation_method.ground_granulated_blast_furnace_slag: Economic allocation due to significant economic value
allocation_method.silica_fume: Treated as waste material, only transport impacts included

recycled_materials_handling.background_data_allocation: AusLCI LCA database allocation approach conforming to EN 15804
